title: Why Your Excel Isn't a System
content:
Your team has data everywhere.

Excel files. PDFs. Emails. Screenshots.

But none of it talks to each other.

Here's what nobody tells non-technical operators:

The format of your data determines what you can do with it.

→ Excel/CSV: Structured, but brittle. Easy to break.
→ PDFs: Human-readable, machine-hostile.
→ Images: Rich information, expensive to extract.
→ Text: Flexible, but ambiguous.

When you understand this, you stop asking "Can we automate this?"

And start asking "Is our data in a shape that allows automation?"

The fastest teams aren't the ones with the best tools.

They're the ones who understand what kind of system they're actually running.

They know where data flows.
Where it breaks.
Where humans need to step in.

This isn't about becoming an engineer.

It's about developing intuition for how your operation actually works.

What's one data format that's slowing your team down?
author: Dylan Goren
